OffsetTransform:
Used to offset a control in global space. This can be useful
to offset a float control by rotating it or translating it.
InitialValue:
The value that a control is reset to during begin play or when the
control rig is instantiated.
Value: The current value of the control.
PrimaryAxis: the primary axis to use for float controls
bAnimatable: If the control is animatable in sequencer
bLimitTranslation: True if the control has to obey translation limits.
bLimitRotation: True if the control has to obey rotation limits.
bLimitScale: True if the control has to obey scale limits.
bDrawLimits: True if the limits should be drawn in debug.
MinimumValue: The minimum limit of the control's value
MaximumValue: The maximum limit of the control's value
bGizmoEnabled: Set to true if the gizmo is enabled in 3d
bGizmoVisible: Set to true if the gizmo is currently visible in 3d
GizmoName: This is optional UI setting - this doesn't mean this is always used, but it is optional for manipulation layer to use this
bIsTransientControl: If the control is transient and only visible in the control rig editor
ControlEnum: If the control is transient and only visible in the control rig editor
Name: FName
